Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Efficacy of Nasal Cannula Oxygen as an Adjunct to Preoxygenation

Trial_Design.evidence: This prospective randomized crossover trial involved 30 healthy volunteers

Participants.evidence: 30 healthy volunteers aged 20-50 years at a tertiary care center

Intervention.evidence: 3-minute tidal volume breathing (TVB) and 8 vital capacity breaths (VCB) with nasal cannula oxygen at 0, 5, and 10 L/min

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of nasal cannula oxygen as an adjunct to standard preoxygenation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was end-tidal oxygen (ETO2) measured at the end of each preoxygenation sequence.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was performed using a Latin square method, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This prospective randomized crossover trial involved 30 healthy volunteers

Result_Outcome.evidence: ETO2 increased significantly with nasal cannula oxygen, with 3-minute TVB achieving higher ETO2 (91.07% at 10 L/min) compared to 8 VCB (87.87% at 10 L/min), p < 0.001.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered with CTRI (no. CTRI/2020/04/024873)
